page.title: 16Health
page.content: The area comes under Clwyd Health Authority but no medical services are situated within it. Inhabitants travel to nearby Glan Clwyd District General Hospital, recently built at Bodelwyddan or to the old H.M. Stanley Hospital at St. Asaph. Community Nurses call on patients by arrangement with their doctor, or through the hospital. On 20th April, 1985 a Family-a-Fair was arranged at Kinmel Hall by Mrs. D.H. Fetherstonhaugh of Plas Kinmel to raise funds towards the purchse of a Body Scanner for Glan Clwyd Hospital. The target was Â£10,000 and organisations from a wide local area took part . On a cold windy day, hundreds of people attended and enjoyed the great variety of events, horse rides, helicopter rides,crafts, raffle and much more. The amount raised was approx. Â£15,000.
